mdRecord.dcterms:title: Visiting speaker Noam Chomsky
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Marshall, Michael
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Chomsky is a linguistics professor at MIT and a noted public intellectual. From excerpt: Noam Chomsky, a controversial critic of the United States' foreign and economic policies, challenged the public's power in our democracy and discussed the effects of free trade in the global marketplace in a talk at UVa February 10, 1993.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
University of Virginia. News Office--Press coverage
